welcWhatsNewDesc.message: Clippings 6.2 comes with many new features and improvements, such as Dark Mode support.

welcQuickStartDesc.message: Recommended reading for new users. Learn the essential features of Clippings in just a few minutes.

welcImportDesc.message: To get started, click Browse, then locate the backup file on your system.

welcNoBackupExpand.message: What to do if you didn't create a backup

welcNoBackupSubh.message: If you didn't back up your clippings, follow these steps:

welcFileMgrWindows.description: File manager application on Windows, for locating Clippings backup folder

welcFileMgrMac.description: File manager application on macOS, for locating Clippings backup folder

welcFileMgrGeneric.message: the file manager on your system

welcShowBkupFileNote.message: (You may need to use the command line to see this folder.)
welcShowBkupFileNote.description: Note to Linux and macOS users about showing hidden backup folder.

welcNoBackupInstrxnStep1.message: Use $1 to find the Clippings data source location. Depending on your previous settings, it may be your Firefox profile folder, or another folder located elsewhere.

welcNoBackupInstrxnStep2.message: Open the data source folder and locate the Clippings backup folder. It should be named "clippings-backup" or ".clipbak". $1

welcNoBackupInstrxnStep3.message: Open the Clippings backup folder and locate the most recent backup file. Copy this to your Desktop or Documents folder.

welcNoBackupInstrxnStep4.message: Click Browse above, and then select the backup file.

welcReadyImport.message: When ready, click Import to bring your Clippings data over to Clippings 6.

welcImportConfirmDone.message: Your clippings have been successfully imported. Clippings is now ready to use.

welcShctKeyNote.message: The Clippings keyboard paste key has changed in Clippings 6. To paste a clipping by its shortcut key or to search by name, press $1.

welcImportError.message: Error reading selected file.  The file may not be a valid Clippings file.

welcImportRetry.message: Click Try Again to go back and select another backup file.

welcLeaveConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to leave the Welcome to Clippings page?

welcImportLater.message: You can import your clippings backup later by opening Clippings Manager and then selecting Tools → Import.

welcCantImportHdg.message: Clippings can't import the backup file, because the Clippings database is not accessible.

welcCantImportCause.message: This may happen if the privacy settings in Firefox are too restrictive (for example, turning on Private Browsing mode).  These settings can interfere with WebExtensions such as Clippings.

welcCantImportFix.message: Make sure that the browser's privacy settings are at their defaults, then restart Firefox and try again. If this doesn't fix it, follow these steps:

welcCantImportFixStep1.message: Open the Firefox menu and select Help → Troubleshooting Information.

welcCantImportFixStep2.message: Click Refresh Firefox, then follow the prompts. Firefox will restart.

welcCantImportFixStep3.message: Reinstall Clippings, and then try importing the backup file again.

syncFldrName.description: The name of the folder containing the user's synchronized clippings.

syncClippings.description: The name of the feature for synchronizing clippings between applications or computers.

syncIntro.message: You can synchronize your clippings with Thunderbird or other Firefox installations by putting the clippings you want to share into a special “Synced Clippings” folder. The synchronized clippings will be saved in a file on your system. Requires the Sync Clippings helper app.

syncHelp.message:
Sync Clippings

Sync Clippings lets you synchronize a subset of your clippings between Firefox and Thunderbird, so that they appear in both applications. You can choose which clippings you want to sync by creating them in a special “Synced Clippings” folder from the New Clipping dialog, or by moving them into the same folder in Clippings Manager.

The Synced Clippings folder will be automatically created once Sync Clippings is set up.

Setting Up

Sync Clippings needs to be turned on in the applications you want to synchronize your clippings with. Sync Clippings is supported on Firefox 60 and newer, and Thunderbird 60 and newer (with Clippings for Thunderbird 5.6 or newer installed).

In addition, the Sync Clippings helper app needs to be installed on your system to keep your Synced Clippings folder contents up to date. It is available for download from the AE Creations website. Once installed, it will be launched automatically when Firefox is started, and will run in the background.

In Firefox, activate Sync Clippings from the Clippings preferences page by clicking Turn On Sync. You will be prompted to choose a file location on your system where the synced clippings data will be saved to, if this was not set already.

syncTurnOffConf.message: Are you sure you want to turn off Sync Clippings?

syncTurnOffRmFldr.message: Remove Synced Clippings folder from Clippings menu and Clippings Manager

syncConnect.message: Connecting to the Sync Clippings helper app...

syncFileDirDesc.message: Your Sync Clippings data is stored in this file location.  If you are synchronizing with Thunderbird and want to change the sync file location, you must also change the sync file location in Clippings preferences in Thunderbird to match.

errSyncConxn.message: Unable to connect to the Sync Clippings helper app. Make sure that the app is installed.

errSyncConxnDetail.message: The Sync Clippings helper app is needed to sync your clippings. You can download it from the AE Creations website.

errSyncOptsInit.message: Unable to initialize Sync Clippings settings. Restart Firefox and try again.

errSync.message: An error has occurred with the Sync Clippings helper app.

errNoDetails.message: Sorry, no further information on this error is available.

syncReloadAck.message: Updating the Synced Clippings folder. Click Reload to continue.

deleteSyncFldr.message: Cannot delete the Synced Clippings folder, because Sync Clippings is turned on.

moveSyncFldr.message: Cannot move the Synced Clippings folder.

syncStartupFailed.message: Failed to connect to the Sync Clippings helper app. To fix this, reinstall the Sync Clippings helper app.
